00017 package WeBWorK::Utils::CourseManagement::sql_single;

00019 =head1 NAME
00020 
00021 WeBWorK::Utils::CourseManagement::sql_single - create and delete courses using
00022 the sql_single database layout.

00026 use strict;

00038 # DBFIXME this whole process should be through an abstraction layer
00039 # DBFIXME (we shouldn't be calling mysqldump here
00040 sub archiveCourseHelper {
00041     my ($courseID, $ce,  $dbLayoutName, %options) = @_;
00042     debug("courseID=$courseID, ce=$ce dbLayoutName=$dbLayoutName\n");
00043     
00044     ##### get list of tables to archive #####
00045     
00046     my $dbLayout    = $ce->{dbLayouts}->{$dbLayoutName};
00047     debug("dbLayout=$dbLayout\n");
00048     my %sources     = dbLayoutSQLSources($dbLayout);
00049     debug("fSources: ", Dumper(\%sources));
00050     my $source    = mostPopularSource(%sources);
00051     debug("source=$source\n");
00052     my %source = %{ $sources{$source} };
00053     my @tables = @{ $source{tables} };
00054     my $username = $source{username};
00055     my $password = $source{password};
00056     my $archiveDatabasePath = $options{archiveDatabasePath};
00057     
00058     ##### construct SQL statements to copy the data in each table #####
00059     
00060     my @stmts;
00061     my @dataTables = ();
00062     foreach my $table (@tables) {
00063         debug("Table: $table\n");
00064         
00065         if ($dbLayout->{$table}{params}{non_native}) {
00066             debug("$table: marked non-native, skipping\n");
00067             next;
00068         }
00069         
00070         my $table = do {
00071             my $paramsRef = $dbLayout->{$table}->{params};
00072             if ($paramsRef) {
00073                 if (exists $paramsRef->{tableOverride}) {
00074                     $paramsRef->{tableOverride}
00075                 } else {
00076                     ""; # no override
00077                 }
00078             } else {
00079                 ""; # no params
00080             }
00081         } || $table;
00082         debug("sql \"real\" table name: $table\n");
00083         
00084        
00085         # this method would be mysql specific but it's a start
00086         # mysqldump  --user=$username   --password=$password database   tables
00087 #       my $stmt = "DUMP SELECT * FROM `$fromTable`";
00088 #       debug("stmt = $stmt\n");
00089 #       push @stmts, $stmt;
00090         push @dataTables, $table;
00091     }
00092     debug("Database tables to export are ",join(" ", @dataTables));
00093     # this method would be mysql specific but it's a start
00094     my $mysqldumpCommand = $ce->{externalPrograms}{mysqldump};
00095     my $exportStatement = " $mysqldumpCommand  --user=$username  ".
00096     "--password=$password " .
00097     " webwork   ".
00098     join(" ", @dataTables).
00099     "   >$archiveDatabasePath";
00100     debug($exportStatement);
00101     my $exportResult = system $exportStatement;
00102     $exportResult and die "Failed to export database with command: '$exportStatement ' (errno: $exportResult): $!
00103     \n\n Check server error log for more information.";
00104 
00105     ##### issue SQL statements #####
00106     
00107 #   my $dbh = DBI->connect($source, $username, $password);
00108 #   unless (defined $dbh) {
00109 #       die "sql_single: failed to connect to DBI source '$source': $DBI::errstr\n";
00110 #   }
00111 #   
00112 #   foreach my $stmt (@stmts) {
00113 #       my $rows = $dbh->do($stmt);
00114 #       unless (defined $rows) {
00115 #           die "sql_single: failed to execute SQL statement '$stmt': $DBI::errstr\n";
00116 #       }
00117 #   }
00118 #   
00119 #   $dbh->disconnect;
00120     
00121     return 1;
00122 }
00123 
00124 =cut

00128 # DBFIXME this whole process should be through an abstraction layer
00129 # DBFIXME (we shouldn't be calling mysqldump here!)
00130 sub unarchiveCourseHelper {
00131     my ($courseID, $ce,  $dbLayoutName, %options) = @_;
00132     debug("courseID=$courseID, ce=$ce dbLayoutName=$dbLayoutName\n");
00133     
00134     ##### get list of tables to archive #####
00135     
00136     my $dbLayout    = $ce->{dbLayouts}->{$dbLayoutName};
00137     debug("dbLayout=$dbLayout\n");
00138     my %sources     = dbLayoutSQLSources($dbLayout);
00139     debug("fSources: ", Dumper(\%sources));
00140     my $source    = mostPopularSource(%sources);
00141     debug("source=$source\n");
00142     my %source = %{ $sources{$source} };
00143     my @tables = @{ $source{tables} };
00144     my $username = $source{username};
00145     my $password = $source{password};
00146     my $unarchiveDatabasePath = $options{unarchiveDatabasePath};
00147     debug( "unarchive database Path is $unarchiveDatabasePath");
00148     ##### construct SQL statements to copy the data in each table #####
00149     
00150 
00151     # this method would be mysql specific but it's a start
00152     my $mysqlCommand = $ce->{externalPrograms}{mysql};
00153     my $importStatement = " $mysqlCommand  --user=$username  ".
00154     "--password=$password " .
00155     "-D webwork".        # specifies database name
00156     "   <$unarchiveDatabasePath";
00157     debug($importStatement);
00158     my $importResult = system $importStatement;
00159     $importResult and die "<pre>Failed to import database with command: \n
00160     '$importStatement ' \n
00161     (errno: $importResult): $!
00162     \n Check server error log for more information.\n</pre>";
00163     #FIXME  -- what should the return be??
00164     return 1;
00165 }

00169 # TOTALLY STOLEN FROM NewSQL::Std.
00170 sub unarchiveCourseHelper {
00171     my ($courseID, $ce,  $dbLayoutName, %options) = @_;
00172     my $dumpfile_path = $options{unarchiveDatabasePath};
00173     
00174     my ($my_cnf, $database) = _get_db_info($ce);
00175     my $mysql = $ce->{externalPrograms}{mysql};
00176     
00177     my $restore_cmd = "2>&1 " . shell_quote($mysql)
00178         . " --defaults-extra-file=" . shell_quote($my_cnf->filename)
00179         . " " . shell_quote($database)
00180         . " < " . shell_quote($dumpfile_path);
00181     my $restore_out = readpipe $restore_cmd;
00182     if ($?) {
00183         my $exit = $? >> 8;
00184         my $signal = $? & 127;
00185         my $core = $? & 128;
00186         die "Failed to restore database for course '$courseID' with command '$restore_cmd' (exit=$exit signal=$signal core=$core): $restore_out\n";
00187     }
00188     
00189     return 1;
00190 }
00191 
00192 # TOTALLY STOLEN FROM NewSQL::Std.
00193 sub _get_db_info {
00194     my ($ce) = @_;
00195     my $dsn = $ce->{database_dsn};
00196     my $username = $ce->{database_username};
00197     my $password = $ce->{database_password};
00198     
00199     die "Can't call dump_table or restore_table on a table with a non-MySQL source"
00200         unless $dsn =~ s/^dbi:mysql://i;
00201     
00202     # this is an internal function which we probably shouldn't be using here
00203     # but it's quick and gets us what we want (FIXME what about sockets, etc?)
00204     my %dsn;
00205     runtime_use "DBD::mysql";
00206     DBD::mysql->_OdbcParse($dsn, \%dsn, ['database', 'host', 'port']);
00207     die "no database specified in DSN!" unless defined $dsn{database};
00208     
00209     # doing this securely is kind of a hassle...
00210     my $my_cnf = new File::Temp;
00211     $my_cnf->unlink_on_destroy(1);
00212     chmod 0600, $my_cnf or die "failed to chmod 0600 $my_cnf: $!"; # File::Temp objects stringify with ->filename
00213     print $my_cnf "[client]\n";
00214     print $my_cnf "user=$username\n" if defined $username and length($username) > 0;
00215     print $my_cnf "password=$password\n" if defined $password and length($password) > 0;
00216     print $my_cnf "host=$dsn{host}\n" if defined $dsn{host} and length($dsn{host}) > 0;
00217     print $my_cnf "port=$dsn{port}\n" if defined $dsn{port} and length($dsn{port}) > 0;
00218     
00219     return ($my_cnf, $dsn{database});
00220 }
00221 
00222 =for comment
00223 
00224 # returns the name of the source with the most tables
00225 sub mostPopularSource {
00226     my (%sources) = @_;
00227     
00228     my $source;
00229     if (keys %sources > 1) {
00230         # more than one -- warn and select the most popular source
00231         debug("more than one SQL source defined.\n");
00232         foreach my $curr (keys %sources) {
00233             $source = $curr if not defined $source or @{ $sources{$curr}->{tables} } > @{ $sources{$source}->{tables} };
00234         }
00235         debug("only handling tables with source \"$source\".\n");
00236         debug("others will have to be handled manually (or not at all).\n");
00237     } else {
00238         # there's only one
00239         ($source) = keys %sources;
00240     }
00241     
00242     return $source;
00243 }
00244
